description: Shows how an American family and a refugee family from Europe who move at the same time into a typical American community make adjustments and are accepted into groups at school, at work and at church. Discusses the need for people to respect and accept one another in a free society; explains the vital role of groups within a community; emphasises the importance of acquiring the feeling of belonging to a group; indicates community values and their relation to the democratic way of life.
